level.heading: RENEWALS, REINSTATEMENTS, AND REACTIVATIONS OF POLYSOMNOGRAPHIC TECHNOLOGISTICENSES (§ 17-8105)

level.text: An applicant for renewal of a polysomnographic technologist license shall:
Complete a minimum of twenty (20) continuing education credits
during the two (2) year period preceding the date the license expires;
Attest to completion of the required continuing education credits on the
Be subject to a random audit.
To qualify to reactivate a polysomnographic technologist license, a person in inactive status within the meaning of § 511 of the Act, D.C. Official Code § 3-1205.11 (2001) shall:
Submit an application to reactivate the license;

Submit proof pursuant to § 8105.7 of having completed twenty (20) hours of approved continuing education credits within the two (2) year period preceding the date of the application for reactivation of that applicant’s license and an additional ten (10) hours of approved continuing education credit for each additional year that the applicant was in inactive status beginning with the third year;
Pay the required reactivation fee; and
Submit a completed criminal background check in accordance with 17 DCMR § 8501.
To qualify for reinstatement of a license, an applicant for reinstatement shall:
Submit an application to reinstate the license;

Submit proof pursuant to § 8105.7 of having completed twenty (20) hours of approved continuing education credits within the two (2) year period preceding the date of the application for reinstatement of that applicant’s license and an additional ten (10) hours of approved continuing education credit for each additional year that the applicant was in an inactive status beginning with the third year;
Pay the required reinstatement fee; and
Submit a completed criminal background check in accordance with 17 DCMR § 8501.
Source: Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 58 DCR 3758, 3763 (April 29, 2011).
